title: Correspondence with Ocean Exploration Trust

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Correspondence with Ocean Exploration Trust
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All correspondence between NOAA and Ocean Exploration Trust and/or the Nautilus Exploration Program generated from May 1, 2025, until the time this request is ultimately fulfilled.

Please include as responsive:

1. Communications - any and all communications with Ocean Exploration Trust representatives, which may include:

• postal mail
• reports
• bulletins
• agreements
• memorandums of understanding
• meeting agendas or minutes
• presentations
• phone logs
• chats and meeting logs from virtual meeting and collaboration platforms (including Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Slack, WebEx, and similar platforms)
• text messages (including messages from default texting applications or encrypted messaging apps such as Signal or WhatsApp)
• emails (including body, subject line, and any and all attachments contained therein) between NOAA and @oceanexplorationtrust.org email domains

The category for this request is Media. I am a journalist with work that has appeared in Slate, Sierra, Floodlight and other publications, and I am requesting this information in that capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by email attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. Please provide a tracking number and an estimated date of completion for the responsive documents.

Sincerely,

Elyse Hauser

title: USS Liberty: Form Required to Sign to Receive Financial Compensation
tags: israeli attack on the uss liberty

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Form Required to Sign to Receive Financial Compensation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our ship on June 8, 1967, and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.[https://ussliberty.org]

In or around 1968, the US government issued financial compensation checks to some survivors of the attack on our ship.

In order to receive that compensation, the recipient had to sign an agreement that whatever the compensation amount was, it was the only monetary compensation the recipient would ask for.

We are asking for copies of the completed form each USS Liberty recipient was required to sign prior to receiving the disbursement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: North Haven Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for Arrest of Christian Senberg (Enticement of a Minor, July 2025)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: North Haven Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for Arrest of Christian Senberg (Enticement of a Minor, July 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera footage from North Haven Police officers during the investigation and arrest of Christian Senberg in July 2025 on charges of enticement of a minor and risk of injury to a child.

Also, any 911 call recordings, CAD call logs, and radio dispatch traffic associated with this case.

Please include video from all officers on scene, from initial contact through arrest and booking.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Robert Blaise

title: Val Peterson

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Val Peterson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Frederick Valdemar Erastus Peterson, aka Val Peterson (July 18, 1903 - October 17, 1983). Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago. Peterson served as governor of Nebraska from 1947 to 1953, head of the Federal Civil Defense Administration from February 19, 1953 to June 14, 1957, ambassador to Denmark from August 22, 1957 to February 21, 1961, and ambassador to Finland from July 14, 1969 to March 23, 1973.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Facility Dog Documentation

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Facility Dog Documentation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

VMI's application and all related records were submitted to acquire a facility dog from "Mutts with a Mission" and to cover any additional handler training. Include purchase orders or other procurements with fiscal records showing the cost to purchase the facility dog and train the facilitator, along with the source of the funds used.  Also, any military or military-like orders (e.g., those red for his promotion to Brig. Gen. September 3, 2024, etc.),  VMI orders, or citations, or other records bestowing or recognizing any awards, decorations, citations, and rank for the service dog in any form from 2024 to the date of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Ryobi Pressure Washer Recall 2025

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ryobi Pressure Washer Recall 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records on the recall in August 2025 of over 750,000 Ryobi pressure washers for exploding capacitors. Specifically, we are interested in all relevant communications between the CPSC and Techtronic Industries (including TTI Outdoor Power Equipment) and any other involved organization from 2021 to present, such as emails and meeting notes, as well as explanation reports that would include test results explaining the root cause of the issue and validation of the resolution thereof. We do not need copies of each of the incident reports.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bob Barker

Thank you for submitting a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request with the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission.  We are in receipt of the request you submitted.  Your submission has been assigned to case/request number #25-F-00661.   Please reference the request number #25-F-00661 in all future correspondence with the Commission's FOIA staff.

title: CIA Records on Information Asymmetry and Disinformation

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA Records on Information Asymmetry and Disinformation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

reports, memoranda, training materials, assessments, cables, after-action reviews, or studies created or held by the CIA from January 1, 1945 to the present that address, reference, or analyze:
A) Mechanisms of Information Asymmetry (How it is Used):
The intentional creation or exploitation of information asymmetry between elites/governments and the public (domestic or foreign).
The use of disinformation, misinformation, propaganda, psychological operations (psyops), influence operations, or perception management to cultivate confusion or controlled ignorance.
Case studies or after-action reports where partial truths or limited disclosure were used to stabilize regimes, neutralize opposition, or shape public opinion.
Analyses weighing intentional manipulation vs. unintended error in information operations or governance outcomes.
B) Underlying “20% Information” (The Content Itself):
5. Internal guides, handbooks, doctrine, or tradecraft materials that describe thresholds for effective information asymmetry (e.g., how much the public must or must not know for an operation to succeed).
6. Metrics, models, or evaluations that measure the level of public awareness/ignorance required for successful influence operations.
7. Collections of narrative templates, messaging frameworks, or “best practices” for framing, agenda-setting, normalization, distraction, or division designed to mask or camouflage manipulation.
Suggested program keywords to aid your search (non-exhaustive):
Office of Policy Coordination (OPC), OSS (Office of Strategic Services), psychological warfare, propaganda, influence operations, perception management, disinformation, active measures, Operation Mockingbird, “behavioral” or “cognitive” influence, audience segmentation, plausible deniability, limited hangout, media assets, error vs manipulation, information asymmetry.
If portions of these records are exempt, please release all reasonably segregable material. If my request is denied in whole or in part, please justify all deletions by reference to specific FOIA exemptions.
I am willing to pay reasonable duplication and search fees up to $50. If fees will exceed this amount, please contact me before proceeding. I also respectfully request a fee waiver, as disclosure of the requested materials would contribute significantly to public understanding of government activities.
Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amaan Rumi
